results.title: The Country mouse and the city mouse
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film based on Aesop’s fable about the a country mouse who visits his city cousin and discovers that despite the fun of the adventure, home is the best place.

results.title: Country doctor
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore, Basic Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The daily activity of a doctor in general practice in a small English country town. In addition to his ceaseless duties among his patients, the country doctor is also a family man, with hobbies and interests outside his professional work and a keen participant in communal affairs. Some of the services available to the doctor and patient under the National Health Service are illustrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred Moore, Leon Clore, Basic Films and British Information Services

results.title: Country Craft
results.brief_description: For many centuries much of India’s trade has been carried out by the country craft, the sailing vessels which carry produce along the 3,000 miles of India’s coastline. They carry the products of the interior and the south to the east of Calcutta, Rangoon, and Indonesia. They travel to the west to Bombay and Karachi, and across the Arabian Sea and the Indian Ocean, loaded with the coffee copra, coir, rope and textiles, the products of their ports of call.

results.title: Country children
results.creator_credit: Chris Pettit and Churches Television and Radio Centre
results.brief_description: A look at two young boys, aged about two and four, who are growing up on a farm that is run by their parents. The parents discuss the advantages of growing up in the country. They also talk about the problem of the boys being isolated from children their own age and how they overcome it by sending them to a regular playschool.

results.title: Counting on the future
results.creator_credit: Anne Boggan and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A film about the population polices of five developing countries: Haiti, the Central African Republic, Ghana, Nigeria and Tanzania. Haiti, a crowded island with few resources, is contrasted with relatively uncrowded African nations rich in agricultural potential. Population planning for these countries begin with a census and education and family planning is accepted only after infant mortality has been sharply reduced. Narrated by Ruby Dee.

results.title: Count us in
results.brief_description: Tells the story of what happens to a person trained for and skilled in a job who loses one of their physical faculties. Shows how the disabled and handicapped can be re-trained for other jobs and rehabilitated as constructive members of society.
